meanings.definition: To remove the entrails or internal organs of (a person or animal)
meanings.sent1: The hunter carefully disemboweled the deer after the successful hunt.
meanings.sent2: The butcher had to disembowel the fish before preparing it for cooking.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite a sight to see a magician try to disembowel a rabbit during a magic show.
meanings.sent4: The tornado seemed to disembowel the small town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual involved disemboweling a sacrificial animal to appease the gods.

meanings.definition: To deprive of vital elements or force
meanings.sent1: The drought can disembowel the crops, leaving farmers with little to harvest.
meanings.sent2: The harsh criticism seemed to disembowel his confidence in his own abilities.
meanings.sent3: Losing his lucky charm felt like it would disembowel his chances of winning the game.
meanings.sent4: The betrayal by his closest friend seemed to disembowel his trust in others.
meanings.sent5: The economic crisis threatened to disembowel the stability of the country's financial system.
